alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity; Southern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 1:17PM PST until December 15 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW TO CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY EVENING... Snow levels will gradually rise this afternoon and range from 2500 to 3500 feet. Heaviest snow continues across portions of Trinity County where an additional 4 to 8 inches is possible through this evening. Greater amounts are likely above 3500 feet. Precipitation rates will taper off during the evening but scattered rain and snow showers are likely through the night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET IN ELEVATION... * WHAT...Areas of heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up 6 to 10 inches are possible above 2000 feet....with greater accumulations above 3000 feet. Precipitation rates are expected to taper off by early evening but scattered rain and snow showers will continue overnight. * WHERE...Southern Trinity and Northern Trinity Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible along higher passes of highways 3, 36 and 299. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
